page.title: 18YEW TREE FARM VISIT
page.content: This farm keeps sheep and grows barley,wheat,and hay(for winter feeding).The sheep are dipped twice a year to prevent sheep scab.They stay immersed for a minute,a ministry official has to attend this event.Two or three go in at a time.The sheep walk through a tray containing special chemicals to harden their feet and to stop their feet rotting.A sheep with triplets has one of them taken away and put with another ewe with a singleton.The ewes head is restrained between bars and the young lamb will begin to smell like the ewe as it feeds.The sheep produce meat and wool.The wheat,the primary grain,is used for flour and animal feed.The barley is used for whiskey,malt vinegar and animal feed.
